body: @copyshop see my example code in the top of this issue.

> @CalvinKirs Hi, it is not a good practice to close pull request without any reason.
> Can you explain the reason?

So sorry, my understanding has a deviation，so this may be a wrong decision
thx，but in v4.0.0-RC2, when i config multi-users it throw errors. Please refer to the errors from the previous comments above.
I send a [PR](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/pull/2921) for this, can you take a view ?

Reason analyze：
BindingTableRule.java, Line 78
`return each.getActualDataNodes().get(index).getTableName().toLowerCase();`
the mothod of toLowerCase caused it.
北京新脉远望科技有限公司 http://www.cyberplus.com.cn/

@betterjava Yes, I found the dependency of `bindingTableRules` and `broadcastTables`.
The pull request is correct, I will merge it soon, thank you for contribute codes.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48242833/63687652-b364e080-c837-11e9-942f-19182a27f9a9.png)

But actually it doesn't work.
Please provide a version of sharding-proxy ,It would be nice if you could provide configuration and table structure statements for the test
JavaAgent How the performance？
We'll test the performance as soon as the demo is complete. Do you have any experience in JavaAgent? Any suggestions?
@tristaZero actual columns more than  logic columns,we should hide some actual columns,is my understanding correct?
i want use the read and write split and the encrypt but i found the column  is not decrypt successful

[byte-buddy](https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/tree/master) have a convenient API to use java-agent and modify byte code at runtime, we can delegate the DataSource to ShardingDataSource using their `Changing existing classes` feature.
@cherrylzhao Thanks for your suggestion, yes, byte-buddy is better.

Project: sharding-proxy
Version: v3.1.0

Thank you !

@terrymanu  My code can work well before I merged new changes from dev branch to local, so I think maybe it  is a problem made by nearly refactor,but I am not sure about it.
We can't implement this feature in sharding-jdbc for now.

> ## Question
> Do you need to configure tables without Sharding into sharding rules, if you only have partial databases or tables for Sharding?
> The official doc gave a method that just config a default data source. Yes i do config default-data -source. But do i need to config those tables without sharding to the "bindingTables" list ?

I have the same question
I have met the same question, did you solve it?
I am not sure whether it is a solution by remove the check.I will pull a request later.
Hello @wowojyc , thanks for your issue. As your say `tb_a` is not a sharding table. so `tb_a` is a encrypted table? Can you show some configuration?

> Hello @wowojyc , thanks for your issue. As your say `tb_a` is not a sharding table. so `tb_a` is a encrypted table? Can you show some configuration?

Hi, thank you for your reply.

In my configuration, tb_a is a common table no need sharding. But when I try 'show databases' command, the same exception happened.

> I am not sure whether it is a solution by remove the check.I will pull a request later.

No, I try this solution. It will throw new exception ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, because the following method will call resultsets.get(0). If the resultsets in empty, these exception happened
Any suggestions ?

I have reviewed the source, this is only supported by sharding-jdbc.
for sharding-proxy, you can try to  make transaction_type=XA, it seems this feature will be supported from source.
orchestration for proxy have some problems with authentication, you can try to fix it.

Thx for ur reply, i put this issue coz it didn't distinguish in the official doc between sharding-jdbc and sharding-proxy. Anyway i will close the ticket, and i will take your advise to test by setting XA type in proxy. Thanks !

I think this problem has some thing with RouteEngineFactory and UnicastRoutingEngine.

I found out this code script by git history, it is different now version. But I do not know why.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9378228/63826286-e4a4f400-c990-11e9-9f39-48e34db17d43.png)

I think It is different, 
1. `SHOW DATABASES`, `SHOW TABLES` can not run right on sharding-jdbc, cause sharding-jdbc can not return without actual sql, but we will implement it in future.
2. You will not execute sql with table which not config. But you can config table be a sharding table or config datasource be a default datasource.

I have read the issue or website about how to configuration default datasource for sharding jdbc, however I am still confused.
I think is is not only mean call ShardingRuleConfiguration.setDefaultDatasourceName method.

What else could I do ?  Could you give me some examples using raw java

I think user can only execute sql which target is logical table on SS. and SS should shield out the actual table. 
And you can get some examples in this [repository](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example).

> I think user can only execute sql which target is logical table on SS. and SS should shield out the actual table.
> And you can get some examples in this [repository](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example).

I have read the examples, but I just want to know the suggestion in the official website mean

 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9378228/63829836-2dfb4080-c99d-11e9-8da4-382622664302.png)

Is it only mean call method setDefaultDataSourceName or defualtSharding***Strategy?
Where should I get the defaultDataSourceName? In my spring Application Context?

If you want to config default datasource, you can see [here](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/manual/sharding-jdbc/configuration/config-spring-boot/).
```properties
spring.shardingsphere.sharding.default-data-source-name=ds
```
Why you want to get defaultDataSourceName? SS will route sql to default dataSource when can not find a sharding datasource.

Same like this [issue](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/2935). 
SS should shield out the actual table, user can only execute sql with table is logic table or table in default datasource in SS.

In my application may exists many different datasource.

So you mean that, for example if the spring boot inject one datasource, but it has no name, I just know its database name is 'db_a'. Do you mean the sharding.default-data-source-name will be set db_a.

the datasource name is database name or datasource pool name ?

Duplicate with this issue <https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/2904>.
Please do not create duplicated issue.
I have tested in proxy, just config a default-data-source and then without those non-sharding tables to be configed to the "bingingTables" list and "Tables" list, it did work. Thank you!
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
Why close this issue? Do you find solution?
This issue is not resolve, why close it?

If you use sharding-jdbc, we will implement it in future.
If you use sharding-proxy, hope my configuration can help you.
```yml
schemaName: sharding_db

dataSources:
  ds_0:
    url: jdbc:mysql://xxx:xxx/test?serverTimezone=UTC&useSSL=false
    username: root
    password: xxx
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50
  ds_1:
    url: jdbc:mysql://xxx:xxx/information_schema?serverTimezone=UTC&useSSL=false
    username: root
    password: xxx
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50

shardingRule:
  defaultDataSourceName: ds_0
```

Here is my XML conf file。maybe the jar file error?
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
	   xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	   xmlns:p="http://www.springframework.org/schema/p"
	   xmlns:aop="http://www.springframework.org/schema/aop"
	   xmlns:context="http://www.springframework.org/schema/context"
	   xmlns:tx="http://www.springframework.org/schema/tx"
	   xmlns:master-slave="http://shardingsphere.apache.org/schema/shardingsphere/masterslave"
	   xmlns:sharding="http://shardingsphere.apache.org/schema/shardingsphere/sharding"
	   xmlns:jpa="http://www.springframework.org/schema/data/jpa"
	   xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans
                        http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans.xsd
                        http://www.springframework.org/schema/aop http://www.springframework.org/schema/aop/spring-aop-3.1.xsd
                        http://shardingsphere.apache.org/schema/shardingsphere/sharding
                        http://shardingsphere.apache.org/schema/shardingsphere/sharding/sharding.xsd
                        http://www.springframework.org/schema/context
                        http://www.springframework.org/schema/context/spring-context.xsd
    					http://www.springframework.org/schema/data/repository
    					http://www.springframework.org/schema/data/repository/spring-repository.xsd
    					http://shardingsphere.apache.org/schema/shardingsphere/masterslave
                        http://shardingsphere.apache.org/schema/shardingsphere/masterslave/master-slave.xsd
       					http://www.springframework.org/schema/data/jpa http://www.springframework.org/schema/data/jpa/spring-jpa.xsd
       					http://www.springframework.org/schema/tx http://www.springframework.org/schema/tx/spring-tx-3.1.xsd">

	<description>SpringJpa配置</description>

	<!-- 定义实体管理器工厂 Jpa配置 LocalContainerEntityManagerFactoryBean这个选项Spring扮演了容器的角色。完全掌管JPA -->
	<!-- 点我查看 spring生成EntityManagerFactory的三种方式 -->
	<bean id="entityManagerFactory" class="org.springframework.orm.jpa.LocalContainerEntityManagerFactoryBean">
		<!-- 指定数据源 -->
		<property name="dataSource" ref="shardingDataSource" />
		<!-- 指定Jpa持久化实现厂商类,这里以Hibernate为例 -->
		<property name="jpaVendorAdapter" ref="hibernateJpaVendorAdapter" />
		<!-- 指定Entity实体类包路径 -->
		<property name="packagesToScan">
			<array>
				<value>com.shby.tent.entity</value>
			</array>
		</property>
		<!-- 指定JPA属性；如Hibernate中指定是否显示SQL的是否显示、方言等 -->
		<property name="jpaProperties">
			<props>
				<prop key="hibernate.dialect">org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLDialect</prop>
				<prop key="hibernate.ejb.naming_strategy">org.hibernate.cfg.ImprovedNamingStrategy</prop>
				<prop key="hibernate.cache.provider_class">org.hibernate.cache.NoCacheProvider</prop>
				<prop key="hibernate.show_sql">true</prop>
				<prop key="hibernate.format_sql">true</prop>
			</props>
		</property>
	</bean>

	<!-- 重要配置：启用扫描并自动创建代理的功能 <jpa:repositories base-package="com.service" transaction-manager-ref="transactionManager" entity-manager-factory-ref="entityManagerFactory" /> -->
	<jpa:repositories base-package="com.shby.tent.repository" transaction-manager-ref="transactionManager" entity-manager-factory-ref="entityManagerFactory" />
	<!-- Hibernate对Jpa的实现 -->
	<bean id="hibernateJpaVendorAdapter" class="org.springframework.orm.jpa.vendor.HibernateJpaVendorAdapter" />

	<!-- Jpa 事务管理器 -->
	<bean id="transactionManager" class="org.springframework.orm.jpa.JpaTransactionManager">
		<property name="entityManagerFactory" ref="entityManagerFactory" />
	</bean>

	<!-- 开启注解事务 -->
	<tx:annotation-driven transaction-manager="transactionManager" proxy-target-class="true" />
	<!-- 4.0.0-RC1 版本 负载均衡策略配置方式 -->
	<!-- 数据源配置,使用应用内的DBCP数据库连接池 -->
	<bean id="ds_master" class="com.alibaba.druid.pool.DruidDataSource" destroy-method="close">
		<property name="url" value="${db.jdbcUrl}" />
		<property name="username" value="${db.user}" />
		<property name="password" value="${db.password}" />
		<property name="initialSize" value="${db.initialSize}" />
		<property name="minIdle" value="${db.minIdle}" />
		<property name="maxActive" value="${db.maxActive}" />
		<property name="maxWait" value="60000" />
		<property name="timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis" value="60000" />
		<property name="minEvictableIdleTimeMillis" value="300000" />
		<property name="validationQuery" value="SELECT 'x'" />
		<property name="testWhileIdle" value="true" />
		<property name="testOnBorrow" value="false" />
		<property name="testOnReturn" value="false" />
		<property name="poolPreparedStatements" value="true" />
		<property name="maxPoolPreparedStatementPerConnectionSize" value="20" />
		<property name="removeAbandoned" value="true" />
		<property name="removeAbandonedTimeout" value="1800" />
		<property name="logAbandoned" value="true" />
	</bean>
	<sharding:inline-strategy id="databaseStrategy" sharding-column="tenantId" algorithm-expression="ds_master" />
	<sharding:inline-strategy id="tenantTableStrategy" sharding-column="id" algorithm-expression="tenant_account_detail$->{id % 2}" />
<!--
	<sharding:standard-strategy id="tableShardingStrategy" sharding-column="tenant_id" precise-algorithm-ref="preciseModuloTableShardingAlgorithm" />
-->
	<sharding:key-generator id="orderKeyGenerator" type="SNOWFLAKE" column="id" />
	<bean id="randomStrategy" class="org.apache.shardingsphere.core.strategy.masterslave.RandomMasterSlaveLoadBalanceAlgorithm" />
	<!--读写分离-->
	<sharding:data-source id="shardingDataSource">
		<sharding:sharding-rule data-source-names="ds_master">
			<!--<sharding:master-slave-rules>
				<sharding:master-slave-rule id="ds_ms0" master-data-source-name="ds_master" slave-data-source-names="ds_slave0,ds_slave1" strategy-ref="randomStrategy" />
			</sharding:master-slave-rules>-->
			<sharding:table-rules>
				<sharding:table-rule logic-table="tenant_account_detail" actual-data-nodes="ds_master.tenant_account_detail$->{0..1}" database-strategy-ref="databaseStrategy" table-strategy-ref="tenantTableStrategy" key-generator-ref="orderKeyGenerator" />
			</sharding:table-rules>
			<sharding:binding-table-rules>
				<sharding:binding-table-rule logic-tables="tenant_account_detail" />
			</sharding:binding-table-rules>

			<sharding:broadcast-table-rules>
				<sharding:broadcast-table-rule table="t_config" />
			</sharding:broadcast-table-rules>
		</sharding:sharding-rule>
	</sharding:data-source>

	<tx:advice id="txAdvice" transaction-manager="transactionManager">
		<tx:attributes>
			<tx:method name="insert*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="add*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="save*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="update*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="delete*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="del*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="retrive*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="query*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="getCurrentSeqId" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="remove*" propagation="REQUIRED" rollback-for="java.lang.Throwable,java.lang.Exception" />
			<tx:method name="get*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="select*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="find*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="list*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="load*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="lazy*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="calc*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="search*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="export*" read-only="true" />
			<tx:method name="check*" read-only="true" />
		</tx:attributes>
	</tx:advice>

	<aop:config>
		<aop:pointcut id="allManagerMethod" expression="execution(* com.shby.tent.service.impl.*.*(..))" />
		<aop:advisor pointcut-ref="allManagerMethod" advice-ref="txAdvice" />
	</aop:config>

</beans>
```
@wowojyc ShardingSphere has many databases and table strategy, you could choose one of them. If you want to hint at a specified database, I think the hinting strategy would be a good choice.
Have you tried version 4.0.0-RC2?
Emm，It's amazing. It works. What's the situation?
Maybe it was a bug before, and fixed in version 4.0.0-RC2.

> If you use sharding-jdbc, we will implement it in future.
> If you use sharding-proxy, hope my configuration can help you.
> 
> ```yaml
> schemaName: sharding_db

Is it ok to use default datasource name same with the sharding datasource name?

> @wowojyc ShardingSphere has many databases and table strategy, you could choose one of them. If you want to hint at a specified database, I think the hinting strategy would be a good choice.

Yeah, maybe.

However, the datasources in my application may contain some table need sharding but other not. I want they both use the same datasource proxy created by sharding jdbc.

> sharding datasource name?

It's OK, `defaultDataSourceName`'s value must comes from `dataSource`.
@terrymanu

> dataSource

dataSource name? do you mean the dataSourceMap' key when create sharding datasource?

```yml
props:
  max.connections.size.per.query: 1
  acceptor.size: 16  # The default value is available processors count * 2.
  executor.size: 16  # Infinite by default.
  proxy.frontend.flush.threshold: 128  # The default value is 128.
    # LOCAL: Proxy will run with LOCAL transaction.

  proxy.opentracing.enabled: false
  query.with.cipher.column: true
  sql.show: true
```
Duplicate with https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/issues/2925.

Please look at [this example](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example/blob/dev/sharding-jdbc-example/other-feature-example/hint-example/hint-raw-jdbc-example/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/example/hint/raw/jdbc/ModuloHintShardingAlgorithm.java) first.

maybe you will get error when you use orchestration and authentication(multi-users) property at the same time.
coz i just test it. when i start the server only config authentication (multi-users) property without orchestration, it works well. And when i add orchestration property it threw the same error.
The problem has been found in the solution, close yourself
so i think it's not the configure problem at the beginning, the root cause maybe that i use orchestration and authentication at the same time. Am i right ?

I don't think so, cause `orchestration` and `authentication` can appear in `server.yaml` at the same time.  I had run it success with `orchestration` and `authentication`. Please check your `server.yaml` again.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14866067/63917440-3c189200-ca6d-11e9-826a-34d10af8821f.png)

In my case here，i just delete the “#” symbol at the beginning of linie like this. and all the code which i copy from you.
---------------
#orchestration:
#  name: orchestration_ds
#  overwrite: false
#  registry:
#    type: zookeeper
#    serverLists: 10.60.0.183:2181
#    namespace: orchestration

authentication:
  users:
    root:
      password: root
    reader:
      password: reader
      authorizedSchemas: neworiental_trail,neworiental_v3
props:
  max.connections.size.per.query: 1
  acceptor.size: 16  # The default value is available processors count * 2.
  executor.size: 16  # Infinite by default.
  proxy.frontend.flush.threshold: 128  # The default value is 128.
    # LOCAL: Proxy will run with LOCAL transaction.
    # XA: Proxy will run with XA transaction.
    # BASE: Proxy will run with B.A.S.E transaction.
  proxy.transaction.type: LOCAL
  proxy.opentracing.enabled: false
  query.with.cipher.column: true
  sql.show: true

Try this again.
```yml
#
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
# contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with
# this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.
# The ASF licenses this file to You under the Apache License, Version 2.0
# (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with
# the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.
#

######################################################################################################
# 
# If you want to configure orchestration, authorization and proxy properties, please refer to this file.
# 
######################################################################################################

orchestration:
  name: orchestration_ds
  overwrite: true
  registry:
    type: zookeeper
    serverLists: 10.60.0.183:2181
    namespace: orchestration

authentication:
  users:
    root:
      password:
    admin:
      password: admin
      authorizedSchemas: neworiental_v3,neworiental_trail

props:
  max.connections.size.per.query: 1
  acceptor.size: 16  # The default value is available processors count * 2.
  executor.size: 16  # Infinite by default.
  proxy.frontend.flush.threshold: 128  # The default value is 128.
    # LOCAL: Proxy will run with LOCAL transaction.
    # XA: Proxy will run with XA transaction.
    # BASE: Proxy will run with B.A.S.E transaction.
  proxy.transaction.type: LOCAL
  proxy.opentracing.enabled: false
  query.with.cipher.column: true
  sql.show: true

```

On 08/29/2019 17:57, 孙不服 wrote:

You can look at this https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/manual/sharding-jdbc/configuration/config-yaml/.

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.

`defaultDataSourceName` can be assigned a dataSourceName what set a actual dataSource. Like `db_0`,`db_1` in this case.
```yml
schemaName: sharding_db

dataSources:
  ds_0:
    url: jdbc:mysql://xxx:xxx/test?serverTimezone=UTC&useSSL=false
    username: root
    password: xxx
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50
  ds_1:
    url: jdbc:mysql://xxx:xxx/information_schema?serverTimezone=UTC&useSSL=false
    username: root
    password: xxx
    connectionTimeoutMilliseconds: 30000
    idleTimeoutMilliseconds: 60000
    maxLifetimeMilliseconds: 1800000
    maxPoolSize: 50

shardingRule:
  defaultDataSourceName: ds_0
```
Can you make the CI correct first?

Maybe is not `leafRegistryCenter`, it just `RegistryCenter`, we can use it for orchestration, `ConfigCenter` just for config.
I am not sure we need type or not, maybe use the interface's type is fine for config and orchestration situations.
We do not need a third interface to extend `configCenter` and the `regCenter`, they are totally split, but zookeeper just implements both.

@liuyangming thanks for your contribution.
when I see your example [RequiresNewOrderServiceImpl.java](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/blob/issue-2902/src/main/java/com/bytesvc/shardingjdbc/sample/service/impl/RequiresNewOrderServiceImpl.java), I want to clarify our current transaction scope.

1.support distribute transaction in one ShardingConnection. 
2.support distribute transaction using local transaction api. 
3.not support distribute transaction in multiple sharding connections. 
4.not support distribute transaction in JTA way.

it seems that you're trying to do some work on `4.` point, in my opinion, the example code can be only supported by JTA, but this is not what we want to integrate currently.
